alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 3:47PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds will impact portions of northeastern Douglas, western Arapahoe, Denver, northern Jefferson and southwestern Adams Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 346 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking several showers and thunderstorms across the Denver metro, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Denver, Aurora, Lakewood, southeastern Arvada, southern Westminster, Centennial, Highlands Ranch, southwestern Commerce City, northwestern Parker, Littleton, Englewood, Wheat Ridge, Golden, Greenwood Village, Evergreen, Lone Tree, southern Denver International Airport, Sheridan, Morrison and Idledale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
